t: Psalm 72
A Prayer for the King
Of Solomon.
God,*pn give your justice to the king and*ln your righteousness to the king’s son.
He*ln will judge your people with righteousness and*ln your afflicted ones with justice.
May*ln the mountains bring well-being to the people and*ln the hills, righteousness.
May*ln he vindicate the afflicted among the people, help*ln the poor, and*ln crush the oppressor.
May*pn they fear you while the sun endures and*ln as long as the moon, throughout all generations.
May*ln the king be like rain that falls on the cut grass, like*ln spring showers that water the earth.
May*ln the righteous flourish in his days and*ln well-being abound until*ln the moon is no more.
May*pn he rule from sea to sea and*ln from the Euphrates to*ln the ends of the earth.
May*ln desert tribes kneel before him and*ln his enemies lick the dust.
May*ln the kings of Tarshish and*ln the coasts and islands bring tribute, the*ln kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.
Let*ln all kings bow in homage to him, all*ln nations serve him.
For*pn he will rescue the poor who cry out and*ln the afflicted who have no helper.
He*ln will have pity on the poor and helpless and*ln save the lives of the poor.
He*ln will redeem them from oppression and violence, for*ln their lives are precious in his sight.
May*pn he live long! May*ln gold from Sheba be given to him. May*ln prayer be offered for him continually, and*ln may he be blessed all day long.
May*ln there be plenty of grain in the land; may*ln it wave on the tops of the mountains. May*ln its crops be like Lebanon. May*ln people flourish in the cities like*ln the grass of the field.
May*ln his name endure forever; as*ln long as the sun shines, may*ln his fame increase. May*ln all nations be blessed by him and*ln call him blessed.
Blessed*pn be the Lord*s God, the God of Israel, who*ln alone does wonders.
Blessed*ln be his glorious name forever; the*ln whole earth is filled with his glory. Amen*ln and amen.
The*ln prayers of David son of Jesse are concluded.
BOOK III
(Psalms 73–89)
